Subject: Apache Struts 2 Vulnerability   (CVE-2024-53677)
Description: Hi Sean, This Vulnerability was found on the Stealthbits server. The recommendation is to patch or upgrade. Is this known to your team and is there a patch to address the issue? Thanks Peter Sterianos Sr. Information Security Analyst Cyber & Information Security Peter.Sterianos@point32health.org Office: (781) 612-4322 Cell: (781) 760-1153
What_We_Know__c:
Customer reported that Vulnerability (CVE-2024-53677) was found on the NEA server.  

Customer is US based. 

I posted a question in SWAT to clarify if this is a known vulnerability or not:
https://teams.microsoft.com/l/message/19:2f33cf4c06364f4c8644adce095eb161@thread.tacv2/1734706120805?tenantId=097499ff-179d-4959-ab02-86d364125bfc&groupId=72f83b71-3180-482b-b588-9595342c5a50&parentMessageId=1734706120805&teamName=SWAT%20Teams%3A%20Product%20Discussions%2C%20PM%20Q%26A%2C%20Feedback&channelName=NEA%20Core&createdTime=1734706120805

If this is not a known vulnerability - then it must be reported as per these instructions:
https://nwxcorp.sharepoint.com/sites/NetwrixTechnicalSupport/SitePages/T1-Support-Engineer-Handbook.aspx#reporting-a-security-concern
Next_Steps__c:
Last Customer Follow-Up: 2/18

Issue has been remediated in the customer environment as they removed the offending apache struts file (not using/licensed for Survery AM).

A patch has been released in NEA v11.6.0.132+, which now uses Apache Struts 6.7.0. Customer has been notified of this, we are waiting to hear back if they'd like assistance upgrading.
Solution_Comment__c: The vulnerability has been patched. Patch will be available in the next scheduled CU (NEA v11.6.0.132 | 01/31/2025).
